intro: Gnaphalium biafranum, commonly known as the African feather grass, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its slender, tufted appearance and delicate yellow flowers make it a distinctive member of its genus. Gnaphalium biafranum is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
